definition: to walk around the stage (to indicate scene changes)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
T-step (basic dance position, with the feet forming a T shape)
artificial beard worn by Chinese opera actors
to perform a jar juggling and balancing act
pole-climbing (as gymnastics or circus act)/climbing pole
